intro: Uvariodendron, commonly known as the African olive, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plants are characterized by their small, often fragrant flowers and compound leaves. Uvariodendron species are typically shrubs or small trees, with some reaching heights of up to 10 meters. They play an important ecological role in their native habitats, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
